reviews.review_msg: Lectures were really important but if you missed class it wasn't hard to keep up.. but if you want to do good in the class just stay up to date with the readings and lectures. she's kind of no BS on AI and other things but she's an easy prof to talk to and she will usually be in your best interest
She's on an ego trip.

If you are like me, sick of students who believe they are so smart b/c other profs just get them to regurgitate info, you will love and appreciate her teaching. She is a no-silly business, no-excuses kind of gal and I love that abt her. Sick of people getting extensions, using AI and not getting caught etc. Dr. Gordon cares about what matters.
she's extremely smart teaches in a way that requires you to make sense of the world around you…however extremely difficult professor and exams that don't make sense

Gordon's lectures start off ok but are overshadowed by her ego and unsupported opinions with no credited sources just her beliefs. Final exam was a joke—attending class felt unnecessary. Group projects presentations disorganized, she made groups change topics just two days before presenting due to her NOT LIKING certain topics. Avoid at all cost!
the most unorganized prof I have ever had. avoid at all costs
Assignments are hard, but lecture are entertaining and the curve is very generous.

Usually I can deal with tough profs but this was next level. I found that Dr. Gordon regularly contradicted information from the textbook, was unorganized, and the tests/quizzes included so many trick questions or were poorly worded. I failed almost every single quiz despite it being open book, and I put in an insane amount of hours into this class

I took psyc 308 with Dr. Gordon and was nervous having heard bad things about her classes; however, the class is not nearly as bad as everyone says it is. Yes her teaching can sometimes be confusing, and the online quizzes are difficult, but she does scale grades. Going to lecture is important though since her slides don't make sense on their own.

Really awful teaching that made it very hard to actually want to learn. I am a dedicated enough student that puts in the work with my studies but this class was nearly impossible for me to learn anything even if I attended every single lecture. Would not take this professor again.

Avoid/drop! Do whatever you need to do to not be in her class. Uploaded slides are not the same she shows in class. She is condescending to anything she doesn't agree with. Unfair to students. Unclear deadlines and criteria. Final exam is a joke as in u could skip ALL semester n still write the final np. She nit-picks DSM and theories

Professor is the only reason the course is hard. Condescending. Quizzes poorly made, trick questions, spelling errors rampant. Easy content. Presented dated misinformation on subjects of neurodivergence (autism, adhd) that probably made some students in the room uncomfortable.

Terrible professor. First class I showed up to she had a condescending tone towards the students answering the questions. She also swore during the lectures which I am okay with but it was very excessive, almost unnecessary. Thought she was having a bad day or something so I came back the next few classes but things didn't improve.

The toughest instructor since the dawn of mankind. I learned to not expect her to be understanding of whatever tough situation I'm in as she is totally indifferent and uncaring about her students' success. She replies to emails once in a blue moon & never checks canvas emails. She ruined psychology for me after having gotten stuck with her twice.
Iris Gordon once said to the lecture (after dismissing those who wanted to leave early) "I hope those who left early get yeast infections" not sure how this lady is a prof, but here we are.

I think Dr. Gordon gets a bad rep. She was nice and pretty fair as to what she expected. The quizzes, exams, and content in general were difficult sometimes but she marked the papers fairly easily and allocates an extra 5% to the highest scoring exam. She can be slow at replying to emails.

well this might be an unpopular opinion going through the reviews but i genuinely enjoyed this class. i found the textbook surprisingly really funny and engaging and tbh i didn't find dr gordon disorganized at least in 308. the quizzes were tricky for sure but i think fair with the mastery grading system  plus the grading policy is pretty generous

Reviews are right and I deeply regret not listening to these earlier.Not only is her class poorly delivered and disorganized, but she is also not fit to be a prof. She tries to act hip and cool by swearing in every sentence that she speaks. I was severely uncomfortable every lecture (and this has never happened to me before). Worst prof I ever had

This class felt like the equivalent of two courses. Was not clear about grading criteria, would make the quizzes impossible to get a good grade on and contradicted the textbook. TA's ditched us at end of sem and would answer "idk" to questions asked. We never got our final assignment back and I got a b+ but have no idea how. Skip lectures
Horrible would be an understatement. Rude. Disrespectful. Does not care about any disability accessibility, and has made fun of individuals with certain issues in her lectures.
Lot of content is subjective, and "correct" answers depend on her opinion, rather than what the textbook says. Very confusing, and makes it hard to study for her exams.

never written a review for any of my profs at SFU, but the organization of this class is seriously lacking. quizzes are open book but super hard, and some answers are found on pages that aren't listed on the required reading pages? very confusing. some questions 0.5 marks should be given, but not. i'm sure she's nice but not the best at teaching
literally terrible, worst prof i have ever had. inappropriate in lectures and quiz/test material was not based off of any of the course material or readings
Great lectures. Curve was very generous. Hard but doable class.

The reviews are telling the truth... do not take a class with her. I thought how bad could it be? Turns out... incredibly so. Everything about the class is uncoordinated. She might seem nice first class but don't fall for it!
may god have mercy on your soul because iris wont

Please don't take anything with her I beg of you. Her quizzes make no sense. she changes instructions for things, and then acts like she never changed them at all. I'm a person who thinks she can tough out bad profs, but this one is REALLY NOT WORTH IT. save your time and sanity
If I could give her a 0 I would have. Horrible teacher who believes that only she is right and not the textbook.

If you want to stay sane, avoid Iris Gordon at all costs. My mistake was thinking it would be best to take this course with her to get this class over with asap, than having to take it in a future semester later on. Now that I have finished Psyc 201W with Iris, I would have much rather waited for another professor to teach this course.
she is a power tripper who gets a hard on for being called DR. GORDON. if you wanna keep ur sanity DO NOT TAKE.
One of the best profs i've had at SFU so far. Cares about education and very approachable. Always willing to answer any type of questions.
she's a terrible prof, avoid.

Quizzes genuinely caused me so much distress, they contradicted textbook content, and oftentimes was not able to be answered by the textbook even though quizzes were open book. Luckily she gives partial marks for multiple choice on exams. She does go on tangents during lectures.

Gives partial marks on tests (all multiple choice) which is helpful for achieving good marks. She does go on tangents while lecturing and sometimes it's hard to follow. You will need to do a lot of reading.

DO NOT TAKE! she is not awful as a person im sure she is okay, and she is generally willing to give extensions if you need more time. HOWEVER ur garde is heavily dependent on tests and exams which are impossible! no matter how much u study you will be confused it feels like a trick. shes more of a researcher than a teacher to be honest.
Lectures are biased and based completely on her opinions, which were sometimes just not correct. She contradicts the textbook and basic knowledge of psychology, and her quizzes are impossible. Avoid.

Changed the criteria for our final project 2 weeks before it was due and NEVER told the TA's [it stressed tf out of everyone]. She squeezed assignment 4, the final project and final exam into the last week of class. Her quizzes were impossible to get a decent grade on. My TA also disappeared in the second to last week of the semester.

If you are interested in the subject and planning to attend lectures - take the course with her, because the lectures are actually engaging (and are kind of mandatory if you want to stay in the loop and get all the good tips and clarifications). 
If you just need to pass this course with least amount of work, then pick someone else.
Being some fentanyl to lecture because you need to escape her uncontrolled and excess yapping.

should be fired, without a 2 week notice with all of her contributions to psychology disregarded and immediately thrown into the dumpster. A total wreck to psychology. Singlehandly responsible for our mental illness crisis.

the entire course was messy and disorganized. TAs ghosted everyone in the last two weeks. due dates are all over the place and the final project was unnecessarily confusing. quizzes were difficult despite being open book.
My favorite Prof lol
All TAs disappeared a week before the finals, I hate this class so much. Every 1 star reviews are true, take it seriously.

She changes the due date for a lot of the quizzes and assignments, we end up having to hand in 3 quizzes, 1 assignment and the final project all in 1week (and a finals in the same week as the final project). All the 1 star reviews are NOT JOKING, don't take any class with her.
i don't even go here but i agree
reading the reviews like my morning newspaper
group project.......why
Don't listen to the bad reviews. The course is hard but the final is super easy. Hilarious lectures.

For the love of god Iris needs to be stopped from ever teaching another class in her life. TA personally told me that the teaching staff had no clue what was happening and another TA confessed she got a 4/10 on the open book online quizzes. Seriously the most ridiculous class, so unorganized, sent me on a depressive spiral. Run.

All the TAs disappeared a week before finals ended?? gives us a study guide for the final the but quizzes were a lot more helpful?? whole class was super messy... and she made some very... bad comments over the semester.
it is SO BAD, i wanna give you a zero, but that's not possible, so i give you a one

I took both 102 and 201 with her and YIKES. Terribly disorganized, pushes back due dates until the final week, contradicts the textbook on textbook reading quizzes, doesn't communicate with TAs (who all mysteriously vanished in the final 2 weeks?), and can't make her mind up.

201: Disregard the study guide she gives you and just study the quizzes.

Worst psychology professor at SFU. Doesn't communicate with TAs, changes her mind for assignments every damn second, and has the most ambiguous quiz questions ever. Assignments and research project are hard to complete when even she doesn't know what she wants. Don't even get me started on all the mistakes she makes, claiming it's an "IT issue."

just completed the exam and lifted the reason for 70% of my stress this semester. do yourself a favour and just wait for another prof to teach the course. NONE of her instructions were clear and she changed the FINAL PAPER CRITERIA 2 weeks before it was due. Also the due dates are dependent on your tutorial timing

I had 102 with her last year and it was just as bad as this course. Very unorganized and that made everyone feel very stressed. While these reviews are reflective of how her students feel about her, I encourage everyone to submit their course experience survey to let Admin know of your thoughts and feelings as well.

changed criteria, instructions, and due dates so much that we had a paper due, our final project due, and a final exam due all in the same week. don't get me started on the horrible project that shape-shifted more than a skin-walker

an absolute joke of a class. all the reviews have basically summed up my feelings towards this course but its just sad seeing how so many people agree on these things. the quizzes do not reflect what the textbook says, instead the answers are what she deems correct. very unorganized, changes due dates and instructions last min.

-2/10. No one knows what we're doing ever. Constantly changing due dates. Constantly changing instructions. Unethical prof. Ridiculously unclear reading quizzes. She pushed back so many assignments and still made us all finish them when we were working on our final project. Should not be teaching. Don't take.

THE TA'S LITERALLY DIPPED A WEEK BEFORE THE EXAM AND WHEN THE GROUP PROJECT WAS DUE AND ASSIGNMENT #4!!!!!! AND THE REASON WAS "DUE TO EXCEEDED ALLOTTED HOURS".... ERM..... HOW IS THAT A PLAUSABILE EXCUSE LIKE WHY U LEAVING US BEHIND TAKE US W UUUU!!!!! WHO GONN MARK NOW HUH?? DR. GORDON???!!! I HOPE NOT CUZ WE ALL COOKED IF YES!!
So utterly shameful of her to change an INDIVIDUAL PROJECT into a GROUP PROJECT last minute and have everyone scramble at the end.

How should I even start this rate. 

THIS COURSE IS THE DEFINITION OF "HUH???!!!" You will be confused all the way through this whole semester, and when u think u finally got it....... SIKE NO U DIDN'T! Be careful for gr projects, read the book, AND look back on the quiz questions for the exam (TRUST). 

RUN FOR THE HILLS PLS SAVE URSELF!!!!!!!!

RUN!!! Iris is actually UNETHICAL & she has caused me psychological trauma that i will endure for the rest of my life. Instructions ALWAYS changing/unclear. she is such a passive aggressive prankster. all TA's suspiciously ran away & ghosted us 2 weeks before final...we were left with no support, trauma, and the need for therapy. What a joke.

lectures don't help you, she's extremely disorganized, quizzes are tricky and answers are based on what she deems correct. students & TA's were in constant confusion as deadlines were constantly changing and instructions were so vague that everyone would interpret them differently. i have never been more confused or exhausted in a class.
I'm mentally distressed because of her quizzes. No amount of textbook knowledge can get you full marks

Deadlines are always changing, quizzes and her wordings are ambiguous (several answers seem to exist for a single vague question). Confused about the final project throughout the whole term. A genuinely curious question: How are we to work on a single paper as a group when we started with different hypotheses, methods and results? Still confused
VERY generous with grading

Her lectures are entertaining but the information in them isn't relevant to assignments or quizzes. Just read the textbook & save yourself the confusion. Quizzes are full of trick questions and the assignment schedule is disorganized & confusing. If you get a good TA you'll be alright (they are the ones doing the grading) otherwise you should avoid

GUYSSS whatever u do, DO NOT TAKE IRIS GORDON. she will give you PTSD if you take a course with her!! she changes her mind about deadlines/assignments every nanosecond, and talks about essential oils during lectures. she makes the class more difficult then it has to be and she is the definition of a Karen. Her exams are impossible to do well on.

LISTEN TO THIS REVIEW!!! Do not take PSYC201W with this prof, wait until another prof is teaching it. I cannot stress this enough. If you are like me and think that the reviews are 'people are being dramatic' you are wrong. I have never experienced this level of disorganization and misinformation before. She should pay for my therapy bills.

Horrible professor who would grade your assignments hard, even the comments sometimes will confuse you. Changing everything on the rubric or what she wants us to do. Always inconsiderate of the assignments she gives us as well. Her quizzes are super hard, she contradicts the book and not even half the things she talked about are on the quizzes.

Don't get me wrong, her group projects suck, but I enjoy all the other aspects of her class. Minimizes exams and places heavy weight on the weekly quizzes, and I really enjoy her lectures. Don't understand all the hate for her... she tries really hard for her students to do well and offers lots of help.

Iris Gordon is the worst professor. She will give you vague and ambiguous instructions for assignments, and then criticize you for doing things wrong (*cough anything to do with the research project*). Textbook reading quiz questions make no sense and negate reading the textbook at all. So unclear/confusing. Iris Gordon is the bane of my existence.
GOOD LUCK, she made my semester rough and I would never take her again. All I have to say is Good Luck
Iris Gordon has made my life miserable for the past two semesters. Fun person. Terrible prof. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Whatever you do, make sure to not take this class with Dr. Gordon. Her quizzes are impossible to do well on, with vague questions and "correct" answers which contradict the textbook. You pretty much have to be in her head to know which answer *she* thinks is the right one. Everything else is such a mess. AVOID!!! AVOID!!!

Pros: entertaining lectures, that's about it
Cons: where to start. 
As mentioned by numerous people here, she is very disorganized with content, deadlines, and releasing grades. Her quiz/exam problems are IMPOSSIBLE. They are vague, ambiguous, and sometimes just contradictory. She seems like a fun person, but a terrible instructor. Avoid.
Sure her lectures were entertaining, but was the rest of it worth it? No.

Quizzes are impossible to get 100% on. Overall grades are hidden till the end of the semester. Goes off topic a lot and does not give very good answers to questions asked in class. Sounds very aggressive when she talks as well. drinks vodka on zoom. You can tell yourself it gets better but it does not.
her quizzes are impossible to do well on, and shes lowkey so harsh do not take her at all

Class average was a D, does not care, skipped class for 1 month in a row due to a strike going on in a different union, cares more about her clinical psychology job, then teaching psychology. Avoid if possible, horrible and her midterms and quizzes are not based off of the lectures/readings etc., it is just randomized, information worded horrible.

STAY FAR AWAY I DON'T CARE BUT STAY FAR AWAY. I'd rather drop this classes because she is awful like I don't even know where to start. Quizes each week,6 writing assignments worth 6% and good luck with the instructions. Group project is a joke you can't use anything from previous semester and you won't know if its been done until the mark is posted

She does not teach the material on the quizzes, and the quiz questions themselves are worded awfully. She uses a textbook but constantly contradicts stuff in the textbook and also creates new terms out of thin air to teach in a university-level class. None of her instructions are clear, but she expects us to know and do everything perfectly.

The worst professor I have ever had. Literally the worst. I cannot caution you enough to NOT take this course with her. She will accuse everyone of plagiarism, take forever to release grades, and also only release the guidelines for written assignments the week before they're due. Good luck!

Reading quizzes were horribly worded and she included answers based on what she believed is right, not what the textbook said even though it was a textbook-based reading quiz. Midterms were also confusing and contained information from the textbook, slides, and her lectures. However she contradicts with the textbook a lot, so you have no clue.

She talks a lot during lectures, but it isn't clear what is actually important vs what she's adding for the sake of adding. Almost all test questions were super vague and difficult to understand. Answers on quizzes were sometimes affected by her opinions, which conflicted with the textbook. The quizzes were exclusively based on the textbook. Avoid.

I am truly shocked at the amount of 1 star reviews for Iris. She's unorganized, isn't clear on the grading criteria, and only gives vague responses to questions, but her entertaining lectures and humour made me enjoy the course more. She gets a big ehh from me, but I certainly wouldn't say she's the absolute worst prof I've had.

Unfortunately Iris has been the worst professor I've had so far. The main issue were her ambiguous quiz/test questions where all the answers may have been correct but she made you put yourself in her perspective to choose which answer she thought was best. Her lectures weren't too bad and I was still able to learn a lot, but she lacked organization

This has been one of the most challenging experiences with a professor. The lectures were often confusing, and seeking clarification only resulted in feeling belittled rather than gaining understanding. The questions on the exams seemed disconnected from the lecture slides and textbook content

Some tips from me having had her twice (psyc201W: B+): read the textbook chapters and understand concepts - helped the most with quizzes and midterm exams! Go to lectures because even if it may seem boring she will slyly incorporate the answers to quizzes in her lectures (sometimes almost word by word). Exams = application-based m/c! Ask questions!

Iris Gordon gives funny and interesting lectures! But that's about it. She is very disorganized, makes facts out of thin air, and disputes what is written in the textbook, making it very hard to study for quizzes or tests. She is also very disorganized. Please stay away from her if you can!

The WORST PROF in SFU!! Some of the  questions in quizes and exams were not in textbooks, slides, or even lectures!! I literally had no idea weherre she got these questions and answers!! She literally made them all so complicated for no reason. NEVER TAKE THIS CLASS!! I'm warning you guys i regretted not listening to the confessions before.

If you value your grades/sanity, never take a class with her. I can't get over how frequently & fluently she made facts up, & then made us feel stupid when we couldn't confirm the idea existed, or found evidence contradicting her. Probably why she warns against outside sources--even the textbook & other profs. Also lied about quiz grades!

Class is curved, so getting a decent grade is very doable. Quizzes are tricky and based solely on the textbook. Exams can be tricky, but short answer questions are almost always things covered exclusively in lecture. Lectures are entertaining. Lots of reading and studying is necessary to do well.

Initially came across as amazing, but revealed herself to be the worst prof I've had (it's my second year of uni and I've been to 2 unis). Her lectures are pretty enjoyable, but neither those nor the textbook really help with quizzes/midterms. She is also very condescending when answering questions in person and over email. Avoid if possible.

I found her quizzes to be fair and most of the answers are found in the textbook. Lectures are very interesting and she cracks a lot of jokes. She gives part marks for the multiple choice questions on exams and explains concepts well in office hours. She's very approachable and nice, one of the best profs I've had so far.

took 201 with her in spring 2023. truly the most traumatizing experience ive ever had in a class. run while u can. accuses students of cheating in front of the whole lecture, does not respond well to feedback, does not REPLY TO EMAILS, does not communicate with her teaching team. truly the blind leading the blind cus nobody knew what was going on.

potential was there because she can be funny and is clearly very knowledgeable -  but unfortunately just very bad at teaching. I didn't need to ask for extra credit but the email she sent out saying she would report anyone asking for extra credit assignments rubbed me the wrong way. I understand the job is hard, but be better.
I enjoyed her class, it was tough at times but its not impossible to do well. She has a good sense of humour. Recommend!

Confusing. Was failing the course because we were only graded through exams for awhile, when I asked if assignments would raise my grade, she didnt respond to the email, becuase I didnt refer to her as "Dr Iris Gordon". Goes on tangents about autism, puts digestive system questions in a psyc course, and is just plain rude. SHE SHOULDNT BE TEACHING!

The fact that the average for the quizzes was 45% that were mind you OPEN BOOK, should tell you a lot about how she manages this course. Her tests are all filled with misleading questions, and some of them blatantly contradict what the textbook or lecture says. If you try and correct her, she'll respond in the most passive-aggressive way possible.

If you typically ignore RateMyProf ratings as I do, I encourage you to take heed to the 105 1-star ratings in Iris's collection. Lecture material and readings are incompatible and insufficient for success. Evidently considers herself a benevolent, capable instructor; I'm not sure whether she suffers from a lack of self-awareness, or of compassion.

Id rather swallow a box of blades than take a class with her. Probably the worst professor at SFU. Run if you ever had to take class with her. Whoever hired her should be responsible because Iris is not a good professor. Ruined my whole experience at SFU

I've had Dr. Gordon as a prof for several classes and I really enjoy her teaching style. Lectures are entertaining and engaging, quizzes are difficult but doable, and office hrs are highly recommended. She's easy to approach and hilarious. Course content is difficult so go to all lectures to understand how info connects. Take thorough notes!

Hard class, but very interesting. Very doable if you put in the time and effort. Quizzes are tricky, but if you do them while reading the textbook chapter you'll do fine. Assignments are quite easy. Exams are challenging, but getting ~70-80% is doable if you study enough. Plan on 5-6 hours of work each week. The lecture were very entertaining.

Amount of additional time you have to put into studying and trying to decipher the lecture content/slides is unbelievable. The textbook is absolutely useless for the test content (both quizzes and exams). Also don't bother asking her for help. She won't provide you an answer. Avoid. AVOID!!! For your mental wellbeing... A V O I D.

Quiz & exam qs are incoherent. Studying the textbook was useless because the qs were things we never learned. Her correct answers are often false. She created a hostile environment. I emailed her to ask about quiz questions I got wrong that I thought were actually right and she accused me of grade-grabbing and threatened to report me. Unbelievable

Was by far one of the worst profs I've had at SFU. Talks more about autism, rape, sexual assault than the actual material. Contradicts what the textbook says. Exams were very difficult as what the textbook says is completely different from what her notes say and vice versa. Do not take any class with her if you can.

Tests and quizzes do not relate to textbook or lecture content. You can study for hours and get a bad grad vice versa. Confusing notes, inaccurate information, class average was very low esp for each quiz, one was at 2.75/9. Worst class, IF YOUR REGISTERED FOR THE SPRING OR FUTURE SEMESTERS DROP IT WHILE YOU CAN!!!!

At first, I thought Dr. Gordon was at least okay, but she's not. Her tests and quizzes are incomprehensible if you're not her, but Iris herself is the least understanding and sympathetic prof I've ever had. (Even the TA's aren't that nice.) It's like she's preying on our downfall and WANTS her students to fail or something. I cried a lot bc of her

class was challenging, with difficult tests and quizzes, but relatively easy assignments. Despite intriguing subject matter, the teaching method made it difficult to understand creating a steep learning curve and the instructor's off-topic rants during lectures. Low average class in the 50s. For sure a GPA killer. Recommend another prof for sure!

Iris is an ok prof. But her teaching style makes it extremely difficult to even pass. She made all our exams online and its still hard to even get a 50%. Does don't take test questions from textbooks at all.. Sad cause the course content is so interesting but I was not engaged as i was fighting for my life

I HATE THIS CLASS!! the way she words her questions on quizes and test are so confusing and hard for no reason? This class does noto need to be this hard for a 100 class!! Don't take it!! I'M telling I regret choosing thsi class.

Worst professor I had in my 3 years of university ever! She beats it out of all of them. Tests quizzes are unclear and TA's mark so hard it's so hard to meet the standards! My 400 level courses are much easier and makes more sense compared to this!

Extremely inflexible and unclear in assignment instructions. Will take marks off for formatting errors that were not even specified in the instructions and is unwilling to reassess. TAs mark just as hard and it is impossible to meet the standard. Multiple choice questions are confusing. 
Save yourself and avoid at all costs.

Worst prof at SFU, maybe even in BC. She should be so ashamed of having such bad reviews and class average. Def should re-evaluate her job because teaching clearly isn't it. Tests and lectures don't match, don't listen to the 1 positive review, it's just her writing them. Was fired from UVIC so that tells you everything you need to know. Awful prof
I already had serve depression and she not making it any better. This might be it.

The absolute worst prof of my entire existence. Literally took this class last year and here I am writing another review just to tell u guys how BAD she was. NEVER TAKE A COURSE WITH HER!!!!!! YOU'LL REGRET IT!!!!!!!

I knew her ratings before but I needed to take this sooner or later. Now I regret it with my whole heart!! She is the worst professor I have ever had and she LITERALLY MADE ME WANT TO CRY!! The ways she words her questions are so confusing, even though there is no need fot it be so confusing. DON'T TAKE HER CLASS even if you need it.
I'll pay you not to take this class. Please listen to the comments DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. There is better options TRUST ME ONG
POV: you read all the reviews but will take the class anyway because you believe you can get by it. I wish the class was full and never enrolled in it - biggest mistake of my life

It was worse than I had expected. Lecture slides contradict the textbook, quizzes and midterms are IMPOSSIBLE. The content is not hard BUT SHE MAKES IT HARD! IT TOOK HER THREE CLASSES TO COVER 22 SLIDES - never heard someone ramble so much nonesense in my life. I spent the whole semester just trying to survive. What an absolute joke of a class.

Tests and quizzes have little to no correlation with the lectures and textbooks. Multiple choice questions are strangely worded, and in most cases, all of the answers are applicable to the questions - very confusing. Lectures are more yap sessions. Extremely difficult for no reason.

Awful professor avoid at all costs. Quizzes are barely related to textbook material and questions have typos and are often hard to understand. Midterms are the same way. Awful prof would never recommend her courses ever. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Avoid if you can, her tests do not match the lecture material and require a lot of inference even with closed-book exams.  She is very knowledgeable but does not help students learn the material effectively.  One of the worst professors I have had regarding accessibility and student assistance.  Prepare to spend lots of time on this course.

Avoid her class if you can. She is extremely approachable and makes you feel dumb if you ask questions, goes on weird tangents and talks too fast. Her quizzes and exams have no correlation to lectures or textbook; half the time they are poorly worded or incoherent.

This was one of the most difficult classes I've taken. Iris is not approachable at all and does not seem willing to help her students. The tests and quizzes have no correlation to her lecture material or textbook, making it extremely tough to get a good mark on them. She makes lectures extremely uncomfortable with her offensive and strange rants.

Stay away from this professor... Even after the semester has ended she is trying to find any excuse possible to stick as many of her students with academic misconduct (there are prob gonna be a lot of false accusations). Her tests and quizzes are insanely difficult, assignment instructions are confusing and her lecture skills are horrible as well.

This professor has no regard for students as individuals. In the few emails I exchanged with her, she was not very kind. If you are not doing well in this class and reach out for help it seems as though she wants you to fail even if you're already not doing well. Quizzes and tests are difficult and don't relate to the lectures.
Horrible.

WTF. This prof seems very interesting in the class, presenting a very nice image in front of students. However, her quizzes and exams are extremely confusing. The answer that follows a correct logic is the wrong answer. The questions in the quiz and exam are very confusing.

If I saw those comment earlier on this website, I would not take this cour

Her lectures are confusing and consists of long tangents where she rambles on about irrelevant material that is sometimes offensive. She had the genius idea of making exams online and CLOSED BOOK, then acted shocked when a majority of the class cheated (yet the average was still low 60s) Now she has spent the entire semester "hunting down" cheaters

Tests and quizzes very difficult despite doing the readings and going to lectures. Questions she creates on the quizzes are confusing and have answers that all somewhat make sense. Only way to make up is to do good on her#2 and #3 assignments.

This is an introductory course, yet the exams are made as if you have prior knowledge. She also claims that exams are 50/50 from the lecture and textbook, but there are things on exams that we never learned. The quizzes are also worded so strangely, that it makes it difficult to understand. Overall, just avoid her classes if you can.
Do not take any course with her. Her test questions are very difficult to answer and often not in the textbook or lecture.

Instructions are unclear, especially on assignments. TAs are tough graders, however Iris doesn't do anything to be somewhat considerate to her students. Quizzes are near impossible to even pass on, and exams (though online) are just as bad. Should've listened to other reviews/my friends who told me to avoid her. do yourself a favor and listen

Avoid this prof at all costs. Her quizzes and exams are impossible. The questions are way too advanced for the class when we are only learning basic concepts. Textbook readings and notes from her lectures don't help. She goes on rants in class about her clinical work instead of providing helpful information about the course content.

Avoid. Quiz and exam questions are nonsense and many are simply not possible to get right without guessing. Lectures are also hard to follow. Exams are supposedly 50/50 lecture and textbook, but some of these answers are found in neither. If you value your GPA take this course with someone else.

for your sanity don't take this course with iris. you will be confused the entire lecture, she doesn't talk about the material in the course she rants about her clinical work and then expects you to know all the material in her lectures plus the exams are actually impossible to get a decent grade on. if you like psychology don't take this course.
Avoid taking classes with this prof at any cost. She goes off topic the entire class and and words exam questions in a way that are super difficult to understand

No matter how much you study or think you know, her quizzes and tests are impossible. They don't relate to the textbook or lecture slides. She is entertaining and makes an effort to keep students engaged during lectures but unless you want your gpa to drop, I would not recommend her class.

She's an entertaining prof to listen to. That being said, her quizzes are impossible. Nothing in her lectures/powerpoints are helpful towards learning material. She just tells stories and only addresses a small portion of material in class, the rest is in the textbook. She expects too much out of students who aren't being properly taught.
dropping out of psyc

I like her a lot as a person, she's very funny; however, the content she focuses on lacks any proportional value on tests. I look back at the power-points and readings and find ... not a single example of something asked on a test. A very confusing and disorganized format.

She seems very passionate about what she teaches and she can be funny. However, her quizzes and exams are difficult, they do not really relate to the lectures or readings. Half the time your saying to yourself ''where was this in the notes/readings?''. Theres multiple answers that seem correct and its confusing when you get ur test back

I am neurodivergent and the professor spent too long discussing autism/ADHD and "clinical" intervention therapies with autistic children. Overgeneralization, did not separate personality from diagnosis, patronizing undertones IMO, and class found some comments about autism humorous. Extremely anxiety-provoking dropped avoid-good students do poorly

I understand that Dr.Gordon could be demanding and insensitive. However, her class is interactive and she tries to make jokes to keep the class entertained. She also does small things to connect with students: giving a toast to everyone with bubble tea. I can see her enthusiasm in teaching! We should be more compassionate toward Dr.Gordon!
do not take this prof. She isn't too bad, but there are others that are much better.

She is a clinical psychologist (somehow) and all she does is relate her material back to clinical psychology. Which is great... except for the fact that this course is not about clinical psychology. So all of her lectures are basically useless and you have to rely on the textbook to pass. The quizzes and tests have the weirdest questions too.
Quiz questions and grades are nonsense.

Rambles fast in lectures, provides a general outlook on material but youll def need to read textbook to fully understand for tests. Big on academic dishonesty. Was very disorganized w deadlines in this course, currently taking psyc102 w her & shes better for that one. Dont let previous reviews scare you, her class is doable w good time management!

I found the course overall not too hard BUT, Iris is not good. Her quiz questions have many errors and lack clarity. HER GRADING SCALE IS DIFFERENT! She says she does not scale, however, she uses her own cutoffs that makes it harder to get a high grade.

A side note is that her humour is self-deprecating, I feel bad for her.

She talks very fast and tends to ramble and get off topic, she'll also try to trick you before your understanding has solidified. She'll also never admit shes wrong and if you ask her questions she tends to repeat what she just said and doesn't answer them at all.

I enjoyed her lectures, but her personality is not for everyone. Assignments were easy, yet the TAs marked harshly and did not provide feedback. The quizzes were difficult and one time it told me that my answer was correct, but the actual correct answer was better. Tests were better than quizzes but still difficult and I usually did worse on them.

Dr. Gordon is a fair and very engaging professor; she frequently checked to see if anyone had questions and would spend a good amount of time to clearly answer them. Her exams are difficult because she has standards but her grading system is more than fair. If you go to lecture, do your readings and ask questions, a good grade is very attainable.

Worst professor I've ever had & is the only prof that has worsened my mental health over the semester by refusing to accommodate me, a registered CAL student who REQUIRES accommodations for my disabilities from all my profs. thought it was ableism until I came on here and saw all the other awful reviews. Also rudely accused me of things I never did

Professor Gordon does not teach. Her quizzes are open book but the questions and answers are very hard and are what she considers is right. The TAs are hard markers on assignments and tests. Her tests are hard and are extremely comprehensive. Should not be a 100-level course for the amount of content. She doesn't curve at all. AVOID IF POSSIBLE.

I really wish I had listened to the people who told me not to take this class with her. Honestly just wait it out till summer to complete this course with a different professor as doing well on the exams is near impossible. Assignments are the only place you can aim to raise your grade. For a first-year course, this class is extremely hard.

She kinda all over the place tbh but like the assingment s are pretty easy so that is something to really put effort into because your grade will  need it. Be prepared to read the textbook like a million times for a million hours because of how much information you need to know.

Everyone is saying she is bad I don't know why. Yeah her courses are hard but she tells you basically exactly what you are tested on. The classes are hard but as a teacher she is great. Engaging and tries to make it fun. Always answers emails and hears you out if you need a regrade/extension.

Great at lectures but they are hard to follow since she speaks so fast. Exams are so difficult: 50% textbook and 50% slides. Assignments' criteria are so broad yet the TAs marked them so hard? Still don't understand that part. Her grading system is good but exam-heavy which does not help. You basically teach yourself, and the content is DENSE.

all i'm gonna say is, good luck lol...
- way too hard for an intro course, take with another prof is you can

She tries to have a quirky and funny personality but just comes off as weird. Her exams are not fair, she teaches a lot in class and expects you to read the textbook as well, which I did, but I still have no clue where her exam questions come from. She literally boasts about the written part of her exams having a 30% average. Quiz averages are 50%.

Iris Gordan is constantly going on irrelevant tangents during lecture and is extremely anal. She is constantly changing due dates, the TAs express how she never communicates with them and somehow, without fail, she manages to connect the material of every lecture in a research methods class to autism. her opinions are also questionable at best.

Class is HARD but I disagree with all the people that think she's an evil witch. Lectures are interesting and engaging. Questions are encouraged, she makes lots of jokes and wants people to do well. Study a lot, pay attention & take notes, read the textbook- you'll be fine. Other reviews aren't wrong about the quizzes, choose answers VERY carefully

Very disorganized. TA always mentioned how she doesn't receive the information in time to give us proper feedback to answer any questions we have. Grades for quizzes and papers are always delayed. Seems to care more about academic integrity violations than actually helping students learn. Rubrics are never available till after grades are released.

She is one of the smartest people I have met. With so much brand-new material, it is hard to remember it all AND be able to apply it in any random situation. The quizzes are difficult. Exams are also hard; also, definitely attend lectures and pay attention because she says a lot that's not included in the slides that you will have to remember.

Gordon is a decent prof, but has a few issues. Canvas page is bad as there are no separate pages for assignments or lectures, resulting in missed deadlines. Deadlines are at inconvenient times, unlike other professors. Lectures are content heavy, often missing slides, making it hard to concentrate. She is funny & answers most questions asked.

Extremely disorganized.
Always pushing back quiz and assignment deadlines; Never uploads quizzes or assignment to canvas on time.
Quiz marking is inconsistent with the textbook and her words.
Doesn't give Teaching Assistants detailed instructions on upcoming assignments because of her disorganized schedule.

Open book quizzes are extremely hard with vague wording. Some information from her slides does not align with textbook info. Lectures are not very informative. Took this class as a requirement with lots of stress. I would avoid taking courses with her again.

Extremely vague and difficult open book quizzes. Quiz due dates are are assigned at the beginning of the semester so many times they're due before she's done teaching the unit. Lectures feel like rants maybe she does this to keep the class engaged but it doesn't work at all since the material she covers only scratches the surface.

Personally, funny and easily engaging.  Slides don't have a lot of info so you need to pay attention in class to get material you need. I found the quizzes harder than the exams. Wording is vague and further context is needed to understand some of the multiple choice questions. I didn't do great on the assignments but I feel like that's on me.

the worst prof i've EVER had in my entire life. tests are extremely difficult. no compassion whatsoever towards students. legit heard her tell a student that was asking for help to just study more. listening to her jokes is almost as painful as listening to her lectures. DO NOT TAKE, AVOID IF U WANT HAPPINESS.

Her quizzes and tests are extremely difficult to the point where it is near impossible to score decent on. All are based on lecture and textbook which is fine, however her lectures are not recorded, followed with hard to read power points. Textbook contains too much material to absorb everything in time for tests.
bruh

Dr. Gordon is the reason why i'm dropping out of psychology. She is a rude and insensitive person with an unprofessional way of 'explaining' course material. Tests and quizzes are filled with ambiguous wording that make it impossible to score slightly well. If you need this class, wait for a different prof to teach it for your own mental sanity.
very disappointed with this course and teacher. She comes off as rude and cranky which does not help her teaching. lectures are boring and the material is not well explained.

i feel it's important to include her strengths- expertise and humor. however:
her tests are so difficult due to their emphasis on her (VERY brief and unrecorded) slides and applied-learning. the quizzes do not prepare you. the textbook is a cakewalk, same one as psych100. it's confusing, disorienting and discouraging.

Her class is ridiculous, her tests are incredibly ambiguous and unrelated to material, she is very insensitive to extenuating circumstances. Her lectures are chaotic and unhelpful, always is rude to students who have questions, would never take a class with her again. Test questions are hard to understand and confusing, would give 0 stars.

Dr. Gordon is one of my favourite professors. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I'd attend all lectures as she uses material from both the textbook and in-class on her tests. You get what you put into her classes, so if you're expecting an easy psyc class, this isn't it. But if you want interesting, engaging, and intersectional, I highly recommend.

Iris is smart but her lectures can be hard to decipher, and her slides don't give enough information. you need to listen very closely to pick out any information. her question wordings on the test are so difficult to understand its overcomplicated. Overall she is respectable, and you can learn a lot from her but be prepared to study HARD

The exams are almost near impossible to get good on. Quizzes are not a GPA booster even though it's open book. Answers that are correct and the textbook proves it but it's marked wrong. She chooses what she thinks the answers are. Lectures are confusing. If you want a good mark, read the textbook multiple times, but it won't help with her exams.

Dr. Gordon ran very confusing and frustrating lectures. The material out of the textbook was easy enough to learn, but she talked in circles and was never very clear. For the tests and weekly homework quizzes, you need to figure out what she thinks the answer is. The assignments were easy, just not straightforward. I had a hard time with her style
Prof was very funny
Quizzes are vague, full of spelling errors, and use terminology not covered in lecture or the textbook. On one of the quizzes, the correct answer was actually misspelt.

I took psych 100 with Gordon and will soon have to take psych 102 with her as well. her lectures are okayish i guess but she is very rude to her students and I personally have been scolded at multiple times (for no valid reason). her tests do not help you learn material and are all mindless multiple choice tests which are impossible to study for.

Gordon is an incredibly funny professor. Her lectures are very fun to watch. However, her tests are very, very, difficult. Many little traps here and there to fall down. Need to know every little detail to get good marks. Definitely will drop your GPA if you're not incredibly careful. I want to like her, but her testing is too hard :((

Professor Gordon is a very difficult person to work with, her lectures are entertaining but being in her class was a challenge. The quizzes are practically impossible to do even though they're open book. Avoid taking a class with her if possible! It's a GPA dropper for sure.

I found Dr. Gordon to be a very interesting lecturer which made me enjoy showing up to her class, but DO NOT let that trick you. Her open book quizzes are far from GPA boosters. Questions on quizzes and exams seemed very subjective as well. Definitely recommend doing every grade booster given (6% for research participation) if you want to do well.

Really difficult tests and quizzes. The content on them was very specific, so unless you studied every little topic in depth, it was hard to do well. Lecture slides seemed a bit disorganized and were hard to follow. She made an effort to keep the class engaged by using examples and videos but it ended up just making it more difficult to understand

Do not take a course if taught my Dr. Gordon, for your own mental sanctity. One of the worst professors I have had in my first semester of university ever. For lectures, she talks about nonsense and makes it hard to take notes. She creates super hard quizzes every week. For exams, she makes them extremely hard and very specific. DO NOT TAKE!!!

Many people didn't like her teaching style, but I did. Make sure to attend every lecture and take notes as she speaks to make connections between the slides and the textbook. Her assignments were relatively easy as well. The quizzes were a bit difficult but they don't bring your grade down by too much anyways. Iris is a very engaging instructor too
Funny, but an asshole. Hard to approach. Conflicting material. Conflicting attitudes. Hard to understand views.

Gordon isn't a bad person at all but her course is quite difficult. All of the quizzes are open book which sounds easy until you try completing them. The tests are easier than the quizzes which says enough on its own. Honestly just read the chapters twice and try to correlate the notes with the lecture even though the lectures aren't very helpful.

I usually like psychology but Gordon made me hate it. Quizzes which were supposed to boost the grade were impossibly hard while being open book! Everything was worded too complicated and not clearly at all. Her lecture style was nit my favourite- she worded things in a way where everything was supposed to connect and click when it never did. Avoid!

My grade must have been pure luck as the average was C+ for an intro psychology course, would have dropped out if it was not a requirement. Quizzes are on content never covered or in textbook, theres multiple answers that are correct but she chooses which actually is. Lectures are disorganized and the exams are lecture heavy. dont take ever.

Exams and quizzes I found unrelated to slides in lecture. I found quizzes extremely difficult and felt as if I was being tricked on purpose with wording... basically every answer could be correct but only one was. Very hard to follow along, a fast-moving course, and unfair grading. Would not take again.

Drops lowest quiz, gives a higher weight on your best midterm mark. However, lots of readings, lectures can be dry, quizzes are tough, exams are tough. Assignments are easy though. STUDY lecture notes & textbook if you really want a good grade in this class. Quizzes are impossibly hard, and the lecture slides don't even make sense.
do not take a class with this professor her quizzes are so hard for no reason. She is highly unreasonable and what she teaches in lectures isn't even on the exams

nooooooo no no no no no no. been here for long enough and think that I'm a pretty average student id say. never had a professor as poorly put together as her. rude to students, constantly condescending and off-topic during lectures, and grades her midterms extremely hard. wait to take psyc 102 for someone else to teach the course

my experience with iris was very hot and cold. for our first assignment she never said anything about it until after it was due where we then had a pop quiz. for lectures she was pretty funny but would go off topic quite often. she would always be super moody on exam days and they were very difficult in that the material would be on a small details

Extremely hard to follow along in lecture, and the lecture slides are very confusing and pretty much impossible to understand. After taking notes on all the assigned textbook chapters and trying to comprehend her lecture slides, I find myself struggling to answer any of the test or quiz questions. She doesn't prepare you well for them at all.

Three midterms that are non-cumulative, which sounds nice but they are SUPER difficult, quizzes are nearly impossible to do good on, and the three assignments on APA are slightly 'easier' to do. This class is loaded with information and made to be super difficult for no reason. Gordon goes off topic often and doesn't elaborate on important topics.

After the first lecture, I could not stand this lady. 
She phrases things that are so mundane to listen to+her material in lectures doesn't correlate to anything on exams. 

-rely on the textbook, however, her exam questions are based loosely on the material and on questions/answers she just 'expects' you to answer 
-doesn't prep you well for exams

NONONO. in my 3 yrs at sfu I have never had such a terrible experience in a class. doesn't record lectures and notes on lec slides make no sense. weekly quizzes with multiple correct answers. what is said in lec contradicts the textbook. tries so hard to be funny but on god she high on smth. avoid at all cost. if ur stuck w her imma pray for you
This prof is off a perc on my momma

Make sure you attend class because some of the test content is based on slides she only presents in class (it is to check if you went/ paid attention in class.) Her quizzes are extremely difficult due to confusing wording and the answers being extremely similar. A lot of her quiz questions can not be found within the textbook or from lecture.

Quizzes/exams are awful - she says they're based on the textbook but some concepts the textbook doesn't even mention! Grading is SO subjective... there are multiple correct answers for assessments but she only picks 1 and won't listen if you disagree. She can be rude and goes on tangents. Her slides are unclear and lectures are painful. AVOID

She is an extremely hard grader. Her lectures are incredibly confusing, however her exams are 50% based off her lectures. Questions on the quizzes are quite confusing as they are not covered in the lecture or textbook. The class feels extremely disorganized as well. The dates on the quizzes were constantly being changed
tests were so hard.

Her weekly quizzes have multiple correct answers, that often aren't found in the textbook or lectures. The mean for quizzes are often low and she goes on tangents in class instead of teaching and often goes off topic. She expects you to memorize the textbook and asks about the smallest details in midterms instead of the bigger theories and concepts
